meanings.definition: A person who carries or hauls goods or luggage.
meanings.sent1: The schlepper helped load the heavy boxes onto the truck.
meanings.sent2: The airport schlepper wheeled the suitcases to the baggage claim area.
meanings.sent3: The tired schlepper joked that their arms were getting a workout from all the lifting.
meanings.sent4: She felt like a schlepper carrying the weight of the world on her shoulders.
meanings.sent5: The image of the schlepper struggling with the load stuck in his mind.

meanings.definition: To carry or haul goods or luggage in a laborious manner.
meanings.sent1: He had to schlepper the groceries up three flights of stairs.
meanings.sent2: She schleppered the camping gear across the rugged terrain.
meanings.sent3: The kids thought it was funny to watch their dad schlepper the heavy cooler to the beach.
meanings.sent4: The old car schleppered along the bumpy road, barely making it to the mechanic.
meanings.sent5: The workers had to schlepper the equipment through the muddy field, leaving tracks behind.
